channel.title: Space elivators
channel.description:
I saw a thing on discovery channel about space elevators, it had a bunch of theories about how it would be possible, and a commercial i have saw recently said that the trip up would take 3 months, and made a good point. Wouldn't it suck to listen to elevator music for three months straight? What would be the point in wasting three months to go to space, when it is only going to be a space station. Thats a six month+ vacation, and think of all that could go wrong...
Well any thoughts? main reason for post: Bored, and can't figure out the answer to my homework so i will procrastinate lol...

item.title: Space elivators
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

I was once watching something on the discovery channel on silk or something. They said they were trying to find a way to mass produce black widow silk, because it was so strong, that it could even serve as light-weight armor. It could also stop a bullet if it is folded over about 3 times.
Then they were talking about how space developers wanted to make a giant sheet out of it, and then make it about 200,000 miles and about 100 feet wide/1cm thick.

I thought it was pretty crazy of an idea, but I think if it was possible it would be much more inexpensive, as the fuel and constant new technology of modern day space crafts are in the high millions per launch.

Read full topic

item.title: Space elivators
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

yes, it was a strange material that took an hour or so to develop and like 12 hours to prove existed, some carbon string or something. Yea i figured it would probably be like a ship, which would be easy, but just imagine being trapped on an elevator for 3 months lol… Does any one see anything practical for this elevator? All i can think of is it may be cheaper to send people into space, i just think its a waste, they are probably spending more money to make them than it would cost for 100’s of times what a normal launch would cost.

Read full topic

item.title: Space elivators
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Didn’t it have something to do with a silk-like material that was like a giant sheet which stretched out to the station?

Read full topic

item.title: Space elivators
item.dc:creator: @yaz yaz
item.description:
@yaz wrote:

I’m sure this elevator wouldn’t be a little box like a normal building elevator but maybe a ship, even as a ship 3 months in there would suck so it would have to be more like an apartment building.

Read full topic
